body.p: To His Excellency B. Magoffin the Govenor of Kentucky --

Your Excellency is hereby informed that the Undersigned Robert F. Baird & J. H. Price Citizens of Louisville and attorneys at Law, became the sureties of one Joseph Millett who was charged with "setting up a Lottery" in this city contrary to law -- And who was required to give Bail to answer in the sum of One Hundred Dollars --
They further state that Said Willett defaulted and failed to appear and the onus of the Bond falls upon the undersigned.
They further state that the charge was of so insignificant consequences that it ^was^ dismissed upon the calling of the Indictment against Willett --
Your Petitioners think as the indictment agst. Willett was dismissed that they ought to be relieved of their Bond as bail in said case --
They therefore earnestly pray your Excellency to remit the Forfeiture in the case of the commth vs Joseph Willett, so far as R. F. Baird & J. H. Price is concerned --

Robert F. Baird
J. H. Price
We the undersigned ask your Excellency to remit the Forfeiture alluded to --

W S. Ward
John Joyes
(see next page)
J. W. Allen D. C
F. B. June D M
Wm Shryock D C
H. S. Johnston D. M

The case against Willett was dismissed, and from information which I have learned since, the Indictment, was returned; about the character of the informers, I think the prayer of petitioners should be granted

Louisville City Ct
$100 } Recog
Baird & Price
